title: I'm so salty
body:
But I don't want to get toxic, any suggestions for anger management?

EDIT: When you are angry and not thinking clearly you play bad, fact!

replies.body:
don't be salty or mad at a player because they are bad or you made a mistake don't say they are bad it will put them in a bad mood as well as you took me a long time to see that I was at a 20% win rate because I blamed people and then they do worst now my win rate is 70%+ just because I don't say bad shit and even if they loss lane or you do you can still win just takes 1 mistake and you can win or loss a game if you  start to feed your lane .i.e. 0 2 0 in kda then go and rome to a different lane and get them mid lanner fed if your top that way you not going to feed and instead your team will get fed       

....................................................................AND REMEBER ITS JUST A GAME DONT RAGE OVER NOTHING...............................................................................................

I lelled a bit more.


"I honestly love attempting to kill people"
           -Toughest Nerd 2015-
well it is nothing and if you gona feed and be bad at cs then play cod its ezy for noobs who cant control them self's
hay I never sed go kill your self I don't care if you do under stand I never sed go kill your self but if you wont go rite ahead I don't care bout some downer or pore me bs
I look at your history the more you loss in ranked the harder it will be to go up stop playing ranked

Yeah but I don't play ranked, I have been level 30 since pretty much the start of the season (on this account) and those games are the only ones I have EVER played in ranked.

This was purely normals
play comfort champs in normals/ranked until you lose that salt.
